response.answer_text: OTA is officer's Training Academy It is one the Academy's which train the Future Short Service Commission Officers of India! There are two OTA's : OTA,Gaya in BiharOTA, Chennai in Tamil NaduGetting trained in the respective Academy depends upon the way of Entry to Indian army: OTA Gaya is meant Only to train the cadets of 10+2 TES and SCO entry ArmyOTA Chennai is only for Short Service Commissioned.(After graduation entries)They are one of the Finest Military Academies, even few of Our Allie Countries like Egypt,Lesotho,Jamaica, Nepal and Bhutan etc send there Cadets to get trained at OTA as foregin exchange programs. I hope my answer serves the purpose! Jai Hind!

An OTA is abbreviation to many. The OTA that I deal in is an Online Travel Agency. An OTA is a travel website that specializes in the sale of travel products to consumers. Some agencies sell a variety of travel products including flights, hotels, car rentals, cruises, activities, and packages. If you wish to start your own online travel agency you can consult us for free at Contact - Quick Travel Affiliate

Officer training academy (OTA, Chennai) is one of the few elite insitute where the Indian Army Officer's are being trained before commissioning to various arms and services of Indian army. Also, OTA is the only institute where lady cadets are being trained just like other gentlemen cadets. there are two OTA in India;older one at Chennai and newer one at Gaya.

It very much depends on the context. It might be ‘Over The Air’ for updates that arrive on your cellular device. In an airport, it is ‘On Time Arrival.’ And only because it’s local news, I now know that in the NFL it stands for ‘Organized Team activities.’ Those are off the top of my head - others will have other answers, I am sure.

Over-the-air programming (OTA) refers to various methods of distributing new software, configuration settings, and even updating encryption keys to devices like cellphones, set-top boxes or secure voice communication equipment . Thanking you.
